infercna 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Introduction to infercna

Find Clones

Source: R/findClones.R
findClones.Rd

FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION

findClones(m, prob = 0.95, coverage = 0.8, mode.size = 10,
  clone.size = NULL, by = "chr")

Arguments

m

a matrix of genes X cells (variables X observations) containing CNA values.
prob

a numeric value >= 0 and <= 1; the minimum posterior probability required for an observation to be assigned to a mode. Default: 0.95
coverage

the fraction of observations that must have a posterior probability higher than <prob> to one of two modes in order for the distribution to qualify as bimodal. Default: 0.8
mode.size

the minimum number of observations that must be assigned to a mode in order for the distribution to qualify as bimodal. Default: 10
clone.size

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: NULL
by

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'chr'

Examples

cna = infercna(useData(), dipcells = dipcells)
# malignant cells only
cna = cna[, !colnames(cna) %in% unlist(dipcells)]
findClones(cna, by = 'chr')
